trans-unit.source: Reads the [deviceFilters Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/2fb323b9-675b-48de-861b-8998fa0c51ba) section of a configuration file that specifies the set of device filters for use with ASP.NET mobile controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileDeviceCapabilitiesSectionHandler"></xref> class.
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates a dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified by the node parameter.
If the object referenced by the parent property is not `null`, then dictionary entries are appended to the parent dictionary.
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The parent node in the configuration file, or `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if creating the parent node.
An <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpConfigurationContext"></xref> object.
The node to be created.
A dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified node.
Required attributes are not present or empty, or the `type` attribute refers to a non-existent <xref href="System.Type"></xref>.
Creates a dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified by the node parameter.
If the object referenced by the parent property is not `null`, then dictionary entries are appended to the parent dictionary.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The parent node in the configuration file, or `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if creating the parent node.
An <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpConfigurationContext"></xref> object.
The node to be created.
A dictionary of the device filter information contained in the specified node.
